N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 441.316 - Straight-line method of depreciation

State Regulations

This method of allocating depreciation is a function of
the passage of time and recognizes equal periodic charges over the useful life
of the asset. The depreciation charge calculated by the straight-line method is
not affected by asset productivity, efficiency, or degree of use. The periodic
charge is computed by relating the cost of the asset, less any salvage, to the
useful life of the asset. Notes
